title: What side was Italy on WW2? - Quora

response.answer_text: Mussolini, Italian leader at the beginning of world war II, sided with Hitler despite its good diplomacy with the allies because Hitler was doing great of the western front and hoped he could gain some land. Mussolini knew that Italy’s army wasn’t ready yet, but he was optimistic that Hitler could have won the war mostly by himself.The war went on and eventually, in 1943, the king of italy decided to put an end to the war. He gave the power to Badoglio, an army leader, and signed the armistice. Mussolini, who was still in contact with Germany, asked Hitler to invade italy. This lead to the beginning of the Italian Civil War. The north of italy, invaded by Germany, became the Republic of Salò, lead by Mussolini. Souther Italy, on the other hand, allied with the anglo-american troops, remained “kingdom of Italy”. In the next years the italian front was one of the main front of the war. The kingdom of Italy grew larger everyday, untill it eventually took over the whole region. The war was over.

This question doesn’t have a simple “one size fits all” answer because initially (September 1939 to June 1940) Italy was neutral, then (June 1940 to September 1943) it entered the war on the side of the Axis Powers and finally, from September 8, 1943 onward, it fought on the Allied side but was technically labelled not an “ally” but a “co-belligerent”; it must also be said that Mussolini, who had been deposed and imprisoned by forces loyal to the King, was freed by the Germans in a commando raid and he set up a rival “rump” Italian state called the “Italian Social Republic” in the part of Italy that was still under German control until the end of WW 2 (May 1945).

At the beginning of the war, Italy was one of the three Axis powers. Its military acted in concert with Germany and Japan. {Submarines with Japan] After the 1943 surrender, the remaining royal government was the only legitimate government. The Italian government declared war on Germany and Japan. Its military joined with the allied troops in Italy and fought alongside them. In other words, Italy was the only nation on the winning side at the beginning of the war and on the winning side at the end.

Italy initially under Benito Mussolini sided with Nazi Germany. They had felt they could join in the spoils of wars when France was about to lose in 1940. Following the invasion of Southern Italy by the Allies in 1943, Mussolini was overthrown and put under house arrest along with his supporters. The new government then joined the Allies.
